name: AdjustStock
description:
Book a set of Adjustments to modify stock.

An Adjustment should either have a `ProductID` or `ProductBackendID` to identify the product, an `OrganizationUnitID` to identify the stock keeping
organization, a `StockLabelID` (see `GetEnumValues` with type `StockLabel`), a `StockMutationReasonID` (see `GetEnumValues` with type `StockMutationReasons`)
and (of course) a `Quantity` to actually book.

Supply a `BackendSystemID` on the request and `BackendID`'s on the Adjustments to make the request idempotent (optional). When one adjustment in your
request fails, all of them will fail. Duplicate keys will not be processed again and yield a warning (but thus will not block!).

Optionally supports a `Remark` for each Adjustment.

properties.name: BackendID
properties.description: Optional, unique identifier for the mutation, combined with the root `BackendSystemID`

properties.name: ProductID
properties.description: Required product identifier (use the `EVA-IDs-Mode` header to switch identifier keys (`Product.ID`, `Product.BackendID`, ...)

properties.name: BackendSystemID
properties.description: Optional, unique identifier for the system that owns the `Adjustment.BackendID` as key for the mutation

properties.name: Code
properties.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

properties.name: RequestID
properties.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: A short description of the error type.

properties.name: ExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

properties.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
properties.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

properties.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
